titleStmt.title: Right trusty and entirely beloved cousin and councellor, wee greet you well, having used all possible and honourable meanes, by sending many gracious messages to the two Houses of Parliament ... to procure our personall treaty with them, for a safe and well grounded peace ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
Ormonde, James Butler, Duke of, 1610-1688.

titleStmt.title: Right trusty and entirely beloved cousin and councellor, wee greet you well, having used all possible and honourable meanes, by sending many gracious messages to the two Houses of Parliament ... to procure our personall treaty with them, for a safe and well grounded peace ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
Ormonde, James Butler, Duke of, 1610-1688.

notesStmt.note: Title from first 5 lines of text.
"Given at our court at Oxon, third day of April, 1646."

"His Majestie having by his royall letters directed to vs the Lord Lieutenant dated the third of Aprill last, required vs to communicat [sic] the said letter to his councell, and loyall subjects with vs ... 21. May. 1646. Ormonde."
Imperfect: creased, stained, and tightly bound, with some loss of print.
Item at reel 1664:22 identified as Wing C2416 (number cancelled).
Item at reel 1760:34 identified as Wing I643.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
